climbs.name: Spider Grind
climbs.fa: Dave Cardosa, Tom and Chris Suler

content.description:
Spider Grind traverses the lip of a roof just before the entrance to Sex Cave.  Climb straight up about 10 feet, clip the first bolt, and start traversing.  Traverse left through several bolts, moving quickly so you don't pump out on the jug-fest, and noting the utility of a good heel hook.  At traverse's end, climb straight up to anchor. 

  Fun and pumpy as hell.
content.location: Spider Grind is the second route on the right as you come down into the canyon form the parking.  It is just before you get to Sex Cave.

content.description: From John Hogge's book: A long traversing route. Climb Spider Grind and keep going on bolts on other routes to the last bolt of Lip-o-suction and finish on Lipo's anchors.(caution the unstable melon sized block/jug in the rest cave just left of Spider Grind's anchors--too textured to draw a big chalk "X" on it; also caution the moderate yet easy run-out to the anchors)
This route climbs bolts 1-4 of  Elephant Man, then moves onto its own bolt line continuing along the roof. The route ends on 38th Special's first bolt at the lip of the cave.

Start up Head but break right after the first bolt and tackle the burly boulder problem on pinches finishing with either a cross to or a sword fighter gaston stab to a couple of jug slots, either way accuracy is of the utmost importance to success. After the jugs the holds start out small again but progressively get bigger till the jug horizontal and the final bolt. A few more moves up over the roof then jump off as there is no anchor.
content.location: Shares the first bolt with Head then breaks right. The first route left of Body Wax following the steep blunt arete feature.

content.description:
Super classic route on great limestone tufas.  Start on the ledge at the front end of the cave and head out horizontally on huge tufas to the obvious large tufa in the cave.  From here start heading vertical. 

  Super pumpy.  good holds and good rests if you know how to get through it.
content.protection: Sport.  8 bolts?  I believe.  no draws needed for the anchors.  they are quick clips.
content.location: Right at the start of the sex cave.  Look for the obviously large tufa and follow the bolts to and from it.

content.description: The traverse above Spider Grind. The start is a bit in the ferns but the rest is clear of plants. You'll get a pretty good swing if you fall so be aware of the trees behind you.
content.location: The first bolt is above the ferns to the right of the start of Spider Grind. I just stick clipped bolt 2 to keep the rope out of the water.

content.description: Hard pulls off of a left then a right 2 finger pocket that have been "helped" in some way, and a final hard move off of a sidepull undercling with the left hand to a juggy rail. Short and to the point.
content.location: Two routes right of Liposuction or two routes left of Body Wax.

content.description: The crux is the fifth draw before entering the face.Â
content.location: Start on Lip-o-suction second bolt and ends on Elephants Man.

content.description:
Start out on the big hanging blob with the crack jug at the back. You can climb the first bit either feet or head first depending on your preference. Once you reach the hanging rib that Lipo climbs you are able to get your feet lower than you hands. Traverse across this under the roof to difficult moves getting to the 4th bolt. Turn the lip here (Roman Orgy continues further and Donkey Lady exits earlier)and make a couple of difficult moves onto the face, this is probably the crux. Trundle easily up the face to the roof. Make some big moves to get into a horizontal over the roof then scrunchy moves to turn the lip. This route offers up a plethora of toe hooking and knee barring jesery through the roof and getting onto the face. 

  Apparently this route used to feature a no hands rest stemming off of a big stalagtight just before the crux at the lip which would make the crux bit seem easier. Though there still is a kneebar to rest on and if you are better than me at using them (which would be most folks out there) it is still a pretty good rest.
content.protection:
4 fixed draws then 3 bolts and a fixed chain draw to lower off of, no anchors. 

Location

  This is the line of fixed draws under the roof that Lipo traverses the lip of.

content.description:
Castle in the Sky is a two pitch route that starts on Liposuction and traverses left across the Sex Cave headwall.

 Pitch 1: 5.11+, 11 bolts. Start on Liposuction. Put a long sling on Lipo's 4th bolt (or skip) and then traverse left across Donkey Lady's 5th and Elephant Man's 6th bolt. The first set of anchors are under the small oak tree, on the large white stalactite.

 Pitch 2: 5.12b, 9 bolts. Continue climbing left over the lip of Sex Cave, traversing across the wave-shaped headwall, crossing over 38 Special. Keep traversing left to end at a second set of anchors near the Sex Canyon routes.
Donkey Lady climbs the first two bolts of Elephant Man before exiting the cave on its own bolt line (between Liposuction and Elephant Man).

Classic Reimers route that ascends what seems like the steepest section of the sex cave. 

  Starts out with easy climbing till the second bolt. Use bomber underclings to set up for a huge throw to a jug. The contrived finish ends above the last bolt in the chossy cave. 

  Don't blow any of the clips as you will surely deck
content.location: In the sex cave center right of lucky strikes

content.description: Starts on the huge jug that's just about right in the middle of the shelf in the back of sex cave and goes through a couple of mini tufas to a big tufa on that shelf. Climb straight to top out.
content.protection: you might want a pad to top out, but it's not very high off the ground
content.location: In the bottom of the sex cave on the ten-foot shelf that lines the back of the cave. The feature tufa on the route is the biggest on that back shelf

content.description: 38 Special can be described simply as Roman Orgy's second pitch. It is climbed often as a separate pitch because the rope drag is very bad if linked with Roman Orgy (see .50 Cal). The recommended "approach" is to stick clip the first bolt (20ft above trail) and jug up from the ground.

Linkup of Roman Orgy and 38 Special. After pulling the lip of the cave, find a wide stem to rest before tackling the 13c/V9 38 Special pitch. This is also a good opportunity to deal with the rope management issues.
content.location: Start as for Elephant Man. Rope management on this route is tricky, it's best to have two belayers, one for the initial pitch, and one ready to go for the second pitch. The FA was done by pre-clipping a very long sling into the 2nd bolt of 38 Special, which the climber will clip directly into upon reaching it. The sling should be long enough to allow the climber to get into the rest without weighting the sling. When the climber has gone in direct the first belayer should go off belay and either the climber should pull the rope down so that the 2nd belayer can reach it and put him on belay, or the 2nd belayer can snag the rope with a stick clip and pull it down. Once the second belayer is on belay (rope should, at this point, be only going from the climber through the first and possibly 2nd headwall bolts of 38 special and down to the second belayer) the climber can remove the long sling and recover at the rest for however long he needs before finishing the 2nd pitch.

content.description: Great looking cave at the entrance to the ranch.  Huge tufa's and pockets provide holds.  Classic routes abound.  Routes range from 5.11 through 5.13.  Liposuction is the obvious line from the platform in the cave through the large tufa and up the head wall; a must-do for the area.
